intro: Bauera sessiliflora, commonly known as the small-leaved bauera, is a flowering plant native to eastern Australia. It belongs to the family Rubiaceae and is characterized by its compact shrub form with dense, leathery foliage. The leaves are typically elliptical or ovate, often with a bluish-green hue and a waxy surface. It produces small, white or pale pink flowers in clusters during the spring and summer months. This plant is well adapted to dry, sunny conditions and is often found in rocky or sandy soils.
